subject: Re: [junit] doubt
msgSnippet: You could do this by using the below api of suite.. TestSuite testSuite = new TestSuite(); testSuite.addTest( new TestHTMLApplets( testMethodA ) );
messageBody:
You could do this by using the below api of suite..

TestSuite testSuite = new TestSuite();
testSuite.addTest( new TestHTMLApplets( "testMethodA" ) );
junit.textui.TestRunner.run( aSuite );

Regards,
Nagendra


----- Original Message -----
From: faiya_m
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, May 26, 2003 10:34 AM
Subject: [junit] doubt


hello every one,
i'm new in using junit.
i have created a class in which there are around 10 test methods(test
cases), and when i'm running it,it will run the whole class.
is there any way, so that i can run only 1 method at a time(or
selected no. of methods)?, i require this for debugging my code.
and i want to use gui version of the junit, not txt format.

thanks
faiya
